instruction: What kinds of spectral preprocessing methods were used for estimating soil organic carbon (SOC) content?

instruction: For estimating soil organic carbon (SOC) content, what metric was chosen for model evaluation and how well did the models perform?
Output:
The metric chosen for model evaluation for estimating soil organic carbon (SOC) content was the determination coefficient (R-2), root mean square error (RMSE), residual prediction deviation (RPD), and ratio of performance to interquartile range. 

The models, both partial least squares regression (PLSR) and support vector machine regression (SVMR), performed well after applying various spectral preprocessing methods. 

For the air-dried unground (DU) soil samples, the SVMR model achieved an R-2 value of 0.72, an RMSE of 2.48 g/kg, and an RPD of 1.83. 

For the air-dried ground (DG) soil samples, the SVMR model achieved an R-2 value of 0.86, an RMSE of 1.84 g/kg, and an RPD of 2.60. 

Overall, the SVMR model showed a more stable performance compared to PLSR and outperformed PLSR with smaller mean RMSE values of 0.69 g/kg for DU soil and 0.50 g/kg for DG soil.
